chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
hi! para empexar go towards the island con el tigre
got it! i'm at the island with the tiger now
it's growling but it's all good. what's next?
cross the water to walk in between the parrot and the elephant on the next island then use the rock bridge to walk towards the frog
Genial, ahora estoy en casa de la rana.
¡Chico, es verde! ¿Adónde vamos ahora?
walk across the alligator onto the elephants island, stay close to the edge, the cross the rock brdge n the giraffe's island
vale, ahora estoy donde la jirafa
finally cross the water using the stick and step over the snake to reach the treasure
he hecho lo que dijiste y
¡ahí está! ¡Hemos encontrado el tesoro! *finalizado*
hi there, empezamos?
si!
all right, first, see that wooden bench? take a few steps to the left. you'll reach a trail
cross it towards that florist stand, but don't get too close. pull a quick u-turn back across the trail towards our white dog friend. fun little loop, huh?
yes! whats next
Ahora, dirígete hacia el sur y cruza ese ramal. continúa recto hacia abajo
Verás otro perro blanco junto a una manta de picnic. ¡Es difícil pasar por alto los cuadros rojos y blancos!
ok im by the picnic blanket what next?
¡excelente! Ahora, pasa por encima del tapete y asegúrate de cepillar ligeramente el cuenco de bayas.
sigue dirigiéndote hacia el oeste. Casi como un momento de Dora la exploradora, ¿no?
si que es el proximo
great, now we are going to cross a wooden pole over the river, this time, heading north
ok im right by the bridge
¡perfecto! evita hacerte amigo del arbusto verde a tu izquierda
simplemente da vueltas hasta llegar al puesto de floristería. ¡casi como un juego de etiqueta!
bueno que proximo
very good, now go west, go under the stand and soon you will see a large bridge with two cyclists
do you see them?
si
great! professional bridge crosser by now hey, except this time we're passing by
carry on west buddy
perfecto estoy cerca de tienda de lechuga
brilliant! Keep going and you will see two men reading newspapers on a bench
Past them, there is a wood and a green bush. head south between the two
proximo?
next, keep going east between the branch and the bush
almost there! don't quit on me now
hey, estas listo?
yes!
¡Frío! Estoy en la tienda en el norte.
¿Adónde vamos ahora, amigo?
ok to start head east for a couple of steps (near the part of the wall that stick out and then get on the dirt path by the telescope
Muy bien, pasé el perro y el fuego. Ahora veo el hongo rojo y el auto azul.
Se dirigió hacia el sur por ese camino de tierra. ¿Qué sigue, compadre?
walk in between the fire y los hogos to walk towards the car. Once you reach the car turn arounf and start following the path south again
vale, seguí el camino entre el fuego y los hongos, y llegué al auto
ahora, estoy siguiendo el sendero hacia el sur nuevamente. ¿qué sigue?
walk towards the telescope, when you reach the curve in the path walk between the telescope and the bush instead as a shortcut
¡listo! tomé el atajo entre el telescopio y el arbusto
ahora estoy cerca de las rocas. ¿voy hacia ellas?
si! walk toawrds the log cabin by the part of the rocks that sticks out
¡genial! acabo de pasar las rocas y veo la casa de madera
¡lo logramos, jefe! *finished*
hola, you ready?
si!
cool! start at the first palm tree. head southwest, pass the second tree, then take a sharp left before the third tree
keep going south. got it?
si caunto tiempo hacia el sur?
just a few steps, friend
then you'll see a brown puppy. go to its left, curve a bit to the left, and then turn right southward
bueno que proximo
you should see a big rock on your left and a small one on the right
go between them towards the water. feeling adventurous yet?
si que proximo
what next?
¡Es hora de mojarse! Camina hacia el agua hasta que te enfrentes a un gran cangrejo rojo.
miedo, lo sé! luego giramos a la derecha y caminamos junto a la gran roca en dirección oeste. ¿Disfrutando la aventura?
si me gusta mucho qhat next?
awesome! after passing a medium rock in the water, you'll see a shark
don't worry, just take a sharp right turn there
got it! que proximo?
get back on land pronto! go between that medium rock and a colorful ball, then head north
bueno! just passed the ball and rock
perfecto! now take a slight left turn and head towards the north-west
you'll have to pass between a red tent and a big speaker. can see them?
yes i can ! then what
¡dulce! Rodea la tienda, haz un pequeño baile en arco alrededor de ella.
¿guay, verdad?
me encanta bailar! y despues que?
bien! ahora, direction sur hacia el mar, pero no te mojes aún
haz una derecha en la costa y ve por debajo de un kayak rojo
bueno what next
ahora cambia completamente tu curso
gira 90 grados a la derecha, pasa junto al kayak en dirección norte
ok then
mira, aquí está tu último paso
alcanza ese pequeño arbusto verde que tienes enfrente

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:

How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
